title: An awareness that current standalone VR HMDs are not everyone's target
details: While I think standalone VR headsets like the Go or Quest are pretty cool, they're enormously under-powered in comparison to their PC counterparts. Please make it possible to create experience that simply do not apply to that sort of hardware.

comments.value: We will definitely design HF so that content can be created for high-power HMD's.  There are many use cases in training, teaching, industrial that will want full power devices.  Our design direction is that we will try wherever possible to have LOD/baking solutions that support both, and then also categorization tools so that, for example, Quest users see only Quest-accessible domains.

title: Edit window should not update dirty values when it polls
details: Right now, the property section of the create tools has a nasty habit of over-writing any values you  may be manually inputting. Please stop that. :)

title: Zones should be able to occlude objects outside of their boundries
details: It would be quite nice if I didn't have to see objects 10 kilometers away. This is also a simple though broad solution to LOD issues.

comments.value:
This would allow to split a domain to support multiple scene. 
Having a "Visibility" restriction flag on the "Zone" entity could also be one of the 2 features that would allow us to fully control the performance. (The other being to be able to set the "Maximum visibilty distance" as a common attribute on the entity.)

One thing to note is that another property for these zones should be if the objects should be downloaded or what priority their download is. This way primary objects can be loaded while lower ones outside the zone are not.

Also, objects super far away are supposed to be rendered by the voxel octree system, so perhaps an update to allow clients to decide how far away something should be before relying on the octree.
yeah this is a must! i have stacked different locations in my domain before and seeing a beach far away in the sky really kills immersion

@losangelesgraff-1: I guess what I was thinking was of a different nature, but I think most of it can be solved with a simple zone whitelist/blacklist feature, which would achieve both concepts. This way, you can have a zone blacklist an outside area or whitelist only areas within itself.

@flamesoulis: This feels out of scope for what I meant to suggest. While I do definitely agree that creators ought to have the ability to specify both LOD target ranges and custom LOD meshes, this is intended to be a simple way to keep multiple scenes sharing a domain visually discreet.
This is part of our core mission as it supports large content sets.
Portal culling between zones would also be a nice feature here I think.

title: The ability to have double-sided polygons (disable backface culling)
details: For trees, plants, flags, or any other object that's basically a quad or simply a flat surface, this would save a lot of vertices.

title: Custom keyboard and xbox controller mapping.
details:
A functionality where people can customize the key's for moving , running and turning.

This same functionality is needed for the xbox controller. So peope,can make a layout that works.

comments.value: It is wise to also think of this as an accessibility issue as well. VR could be an astounding way for a paraplegic to socialize, but would need the ability to customize controls. Imagine having to ask your care taker to push buttons for you to get anything done!

title: CHAT REQUEST: Send a request to start a direct message to a user who is online in the same domain
CHAT REQUEST: Send a message to a user who is online in a different domain

comments.value: i dont know why this is not naturally part of the platform. i know Philip wants to minimize liability but this should be a basic feature added long ago. a voice chat should also be a feature wtf
@philip plans to comment here :)

To do this well is a HUGE amount of work - today's expectation as to features and quality will be to match Discord or Slack.  For example, do you want infinite scrollback of the conversation?  How about auto-complete?  What about unpacking URL's and creating thumbnails?  Highly customizeable notifications?   If we do this well, we won't work on anything else for a long time.  If we do it poorly?  I guess that's the question.  Do you want us to do something really minimal, for example "I can send Judas a message that pops up for a few secs as a notification on his screen"?  Is that better than just having us all use Discord, like many people are already doing?

Would it be better if we provided a mechanism whereby you could automatically share your username/credentials on your favorite chat service (Discord, etc) with the people that you become friends with in Hifi?  It would seem that might be better than trying to re-create yet another messaging service?
@philip-47: would this work in vr

@philip-47: I would prefer not to mix my "outside" contacts with my "high fidelity" contacts just to send a message in high fidelity. To avoid reinventing the wheel, how about implementing an XMPP server that you could log into with your High Fidelity account, and then as resources become available add XMPP client capabilities to the interface?
@losangelesgraff-1: yes
I see a group of people stood on a domain, one of my friends is there, but i dont know the rest. I want to check if its ok to drop in, I want to check that the troll isnt there b4 I go
I also added a forum thread on this topic.... https://forums.highfidelity.com/t/discussion-on-how-best-to-do-text-chat/15298/3

i really dont know much about coding. but i mean i dont think we are looking for something like discord we dont need to send each other egg plant emojis or files. all we really need is a chat app where we can message each other and send links. but again thats just my opinion.

Fundamentally, we agree and believe that this feature is a requirement - being able to message people you've met in Hifi, whether or not they are online.   I'm going to move this to planned.  But we still are not sure what software to use, or how to staff the project.  Thoughts welcome.

title: Upgrades to Asset Server/Browser
details:
The asset server/browser is being used alot more by users these days. It would be very useful if we can get more features for it.
e.g.
Multi-file uploading
(Multi) file downloading for users with permission
Permissions! (can only read/write or can only use a certain folder etc)

comments.value: Agree one hundred percent. Using ATP is rather painful right now both in terms of functionality and performance.

Also ability to go public.
That way, files can be referred to with atp://voxel/avs/myavatar.fst

This can be a benefit for added protection and could allow domain operators to use their domain for more things.

title: Animate fullbody users when locomoting
details:
As of right now you simply hold your physical pose and slide along the terrain when you locomote when using fullbody tracking, which I find very unmotivating to use because of how silly it looks.
I think it would be much better to at least have the option to play the normal VR animations for the legs when moving artificially.

comments.value: I very much agree with this and would like to see it work similarly to VRChat. While implementing this, I would also like to see slots in the Avatar tablet app for each saved/bookmarked avatar where a URL to an animation override could be referenced for the main locomotion states (idle, forward, reverse, fly, etc.)

Ugh..... please no. There IS a script that already does this on the GitHub but in the end, it doesn't work that well and is pretty off putting.

It's very disorientating to the users of full body. In long stretches, I can see perhaps the option to turn something on but for normal use, it'd be something I'd modify out of the client.
@flamesoulis: Could you link me the script?

And... yep! Just disable line 54 it it will only animate the legs and leave the rest alone! The script, however, is still finicky and timing is pretty tough to work out the timing. I'll see if I can't at least correct the timing to use milliseconds for attack and release. Logic part of the animation system... eh....

Would be great if there was documentation on the animation handler.

Oh god, have you people never used VR? 🤪 If I can't control my avatar (at all times!) it makes me sick 🤮 Who cares what other people see when I float around. If I floated around in the real world, my body wouldn't animate 😂
Currently scoping. We're taking the comments into consideration.

Since I can't reply to administrative posts, as I mentioned before, THIS MUST BE OPTIONAL. I cannot stress this enough. In addition to what I mentioned, there is something under hifi-content that already does this, but at this time, it turns off all IK by default unless you comment out line 54 (which then breaks strafing for some weird reason).

A:  Yes obviously agree such a thing would be optional / scripted.  How about if when you locomote, a flying carpet appears underneath you.  Agree that obviously if you wanted to leave it off and pretend to be on heelies, that's lovely too.  

B:  One of the larger platform features that we think also makes sense is making what you see versus what other people see in the way of your avatar joint animations different things.  So, for example, you could see your legs under you where you expect, while other people saw you strolling with a perfect walk cycle.

@philip-47: Hmm.... so local side overrides? I mean, that'd be a snazzy feature.

The idea of having something appear when that happens could be interesting, even perhaps a marketplace item opportunity (where you can buy varying kinds of 'overrides'). With the foot position function (don't remember it offhand), this could be very easy to pull off.

title: Ability to organize and hide tablet buttons
details:
Add in the ability to hide and show tablet buttons and rearrange their order

Signals for when the buttons are hidden or reorganized by the user should also be added so creators can know if their button was moved or hidden.

comments.value:
This is crucial! 
With ever more apps being added to the tablet (which sometimes can be super glitchy itself) the ability to move one's personal favorites to the front pages becomes ever more important.
Tablet app customization is coming.

title: Change the way items are rezzed
details: Right now, HiFi will rez an item as soon as it is downloaded. It just pops in. Give us the option to gracefully rez assets. Fade them in. On the flip side, allow us to announce their completion. Have all assets rez in with an effect like the one used for avatars when they rez in and out.

title: Allow domain owner to dictate asset load order/priority
details: Give us the ability prioritise which world assets are loaded in first. Either a simple implantation like hi/med/low probity or a highly granular system.

comments.value: We agree that there is a need to give creators some level of control over loading content.

As per Release 80's notes:

Fixed an issue where avatars drop through the floor when loading, because they were able to move too soon. We now don’t allow avatar movement until the floor renders and physics is enabled.

This now has even higher priority than ever, since no priority means waiting for entire domains full of content to load before people can move.

mergeHistory.postDetails:
If we could have an Attribute "Maximum distance of Visibility" on an entity, this would be an easy way for the creator to optimize what is require to be loaded from any area. This Distance would be considered in addition of the LOD, discarding the entity at the moment the distance is higher.

So I can chose to discard some object from the view inside the normal LOD for some specific context.   

This, coupled with the Zone with restricted visibility, could satisfied most of the use cases to optimize the display of the entities.
mergeHistory.postTitle: Ability to set implicitely the "Maximum Distance of Visibility" on any entities.

title: Re-scale multi-selected and parented objects
details: When editing a selection with multiple entities, allow rescaling.  When editing an entity with parent and children, allow rescaling of both.

comments.value: We're looking into this. Stay tuned.
This makes sense to do. Scoping and timing TBD.

title: Ability to temporarily remove a user from my domain
details: Allow domain admins to set the number of minutes/hours a user is not allowed into the domain for.

comments.value: This seems like a reasonable idea. We're looking into it.
We think this is a good idea, we'll do it at some point. Timing TBD.

title: Additional lighting features, like shadows
details: This will help create domains that rely more heavily on moving spotlights/shadows.

comments.value: This one is confusing, as we already have shadows. Does this mean shadows for lights other than a zone's key light?
@marcusllewellyn: Yep that's what they are talking about
We agree this feature should be in the rendering engine. We're not able to commit to a timeline at this point.

Often what we need is just a means of blocking a light, rather than giving it a full expensive shadow.
In another engine, we got enormous mileage from 'light clip planes', where the pixel shader only applies the light if the pixel is on the right side of the planes that the artist can define for the light.
Each plane had a 'fade width' property, allowing us to create fake soft shadows or light shafts.
Similarlly, some engines allow lights to be restricted to only apply to pixels that are inside a certain volume.

Will be also nice to have a checkbox on the lights to affect or not the specullarity, in this way we can have high intensity lights that will not burn objects and some low intensity lights for specularity. Using this approach we can simulate the indirect lighting.

title: Full glTF Support
details: It's a preferred file type, specifically for materials and animations.

comments.value: I recently ported a scene into Blender 2.8's Eevee renderer, and what I saw there looks a LOT more like what I might expect to see in High Fidelity. Supporting as much of the GLTF specification as possible is a must as this is a format that has strong support in the Blender community.

We currently support GLTF models as entities and we are chipping away improving support for glTF. As many users may know already, this feature request is tricky as the standards for glTF is evolving. We plan to break this feature request into smaller sub-feature requests so that we can better apprise users of our progress.

@emily-iwankovitsch: It's great to know that High Fidelity recognizes this as an important feature!

Per evolving specs, it's not that tricky. Let's just say you're targeting glTF 2.0. The spec for that is pretty solid at this point. If you can at least import Khronos validated glTF meshes that include armatures, animations and blendshapes, you ought to be most of the way there.

Static meshes work, but it isn't unknown for the viewer to crash when trying to load one, and the ATP service seems a bit hit or miss about glTFs. In addition, the oven doesn't yet support baking glTF.

For creators using Blender, this really, really isn't an optional feature. With the removal of the old Blender Render Engine, glTF is currently the ONLY exporter Blender 2.8 has that can export a mesh with PBR materials. What more, it's probably the only exporter that is actually fully compatible with High Fidelity's PBR materials.

Update: We are working on this now. We have a couple developers already working on this. In particular updating our file parsing code to support the latest gltf features, as well as support for handling materials in the gltf file. We don't yet have a release date for this. But we currently think we'll release it in the 81 time frame.
@zappoman-1: <happydance />
Scheduled for v0.79.0
We are working on this, but it will be in  the 81 release time frame.
Here is another update, planned for version 0.80 - Add support for Roughness/Metallic in GLTF models https://github.com/highfidelity/hifi/pull/14890
We are actively working on this!

title: Show number count on items that I own multiple of in inventory
details: When going into inventory, I see multiples of the same item if I own more than one. It would be easier to see a number count on how many I have.

comments.value: In addition to number owned, to number rezzed/not rezzed. Otherwise knowing how many are owned won't mean anything since it won't be known how many are available to be rezzed.
Currently scoping
Fix planned for v0.83.0
We are still working on this, but we've had to push it to a later release.

bonus: be able to group them in one entry with the quantity indicator, if desired.

double bonus: show which copy(ies) is(are) currently rezzed.

title: CHAT REQUEST: Open a public chat for all users in a domain

comments.value: Doesn't the "Chat" script provide this?
Text chat should be default. To presume otherwise excludes people.

I feel this is crucial. I know that reading text while in VR can be a pain, and that chat.js is already in the client. The problem is that it is not running by default and this greatly affects hearing/speech impaired users. In the past I've had great difficulty telling people how to turn on chat through the use of a sign or text entity, and having chat.js running by default would make this platform a bit more accessible for everyone.

title: CHAT REQUEST: Send a direct message to a user who is offline
Add support for shaders on meshes and avatars
details: Add a UI that allows drag and drop capability and sliders.

comments.value: There are two different big ideas here: (1) We provide the ability for open-ended custom shaders, or (2) we provide built in support for the most commonly used shader effects, such as toon and cell shading. Help us understand which one users are more interested in the comments. Go!

With out a doubts  we need custom shader support. it just not going to work any other way. though it would be ok to maybe have market placed approved shader for mobile space. So maybe add a fall back shader on avatar. 
(1) for sure

Allowing users to create their own shaders opens opportunity for some very customizable and powerful effects! Kinda like the ones found in VRChat.

To clarify, option (1) please!
Custom shaders should take priority, let users make kits and scripts to apply presets to your avatar.
Custom shaders. Unleash the creativity.
Option (1) for sure!
yeah i am with this too. iv seen so much cool stuff with shaders i am really shocked hifi isn't doing really anything with shaders :<

Would prefer option 1 as well. Built in shaders have not had a great track record in the past such as the grab outlining shader, it is just easier to troubleshoot a user defined shader that is not working on a graphics card. Then be stuck with a built in shader that is not working on your graphics card but every one is using.

Option 2 isn't really scalable for the community or hifi. People are going to want different options/customization on every shader and material. It's not feasible for hifi to keep up or the users to put in requests/cannies per (spatmap/terrain/dress/hair/toon/space/etc....) shader that the community like to develop.

Option 1 really solves this in a way that doesn't come back to bite hifi. It also enables the community create and explore much faster.

Do option 1 for sure, but also provide some defaults. Having a couple build in defaults could be helpful for beginners. I also like the idea of having a fallback default shader in case a device isn't able to handle the custom shaders.

I am very much in favor of giving people complete access to custom shaders, but I want to also draw attention to a couple of ancillary implementation details which I believe are important to making this feature work well in the long term.

One is that the application of avatar shaders should probably hook into an API which allow users and/or server operators to whitelist or blacklist shaders, as well as providing shaders with a definable fallback mechanism where blocked or unsupported shaders can attempt to load something valid, and that shaders can also have the ability to force a forward rendering path since some of the most popular toon shaders out there currently depend on this approach.

That said, while I am very much in favor of giving users full control over shaders, there may very well be some value in a set of reliable officially supported shaders implementing basic forms of toon rendering, maybe looking into the VRM toon shader as a starting point (https://dwango.github.io/en/vrm/).

Shaders are a complicated implementation detail for custom engines, and it is understandable that a lot of care and consideration should be given to getting the implementation right.

Option 1 definitely! I don't mind that we can't do screen space shaders, but I've been doing all kinds of shaders with ray marching like portals, water, psychedelic looking things and it's a great way to express oneself. On other social platforms, my avatar was partially put together from different types of shaders which was lovely and I could change my looks often.

It almost optimizes things like scrolling banners or rainbowing part of a mesh which you can do with a material entity, but updating an entity constantly isn't a good solution at all.

I'm pretty happy to see getProceduralFragmentWithPosition() now, tho alpha is a thing we don't have access too, but thank you Sam!
Shaders on avatars increases the ways we can express ourselves enormously. Commonly used shader support is nice, but does not empower the community the way custom shader support does.
YES PLEASE. Shaders help us look like exactly how we want to look and express ourselves. It should really already be a thing honestly.

@ashleigh-harris: Personally, I’m down for either option as long as it gives me the ability to edit the way a model looks after importing. Blender has proven to be a pain when it comes to editing materials for me at least.

title: Allow people to choose who they get notifications about
details: Users with many connections get a lot of messages/large list of notifications

comments.value: A thousand times THIS! During my tour of Nefetari's tomb, this completely impacted my overall experience. I don't need to know where people are going! I'm trying to enjoy a tour!
How about a 'Do Not Disturb' toggle?  Need a simple way to approach.

title: Show nametags by default
details: Have to go to the MP in order to get nametags. Should be available by default.

comments.value:
Available, yes. On by default, no. Nametags is a hit and miss preference, where some want it, and others do not.

That being said, it wouldn't hurt to ask the user at start do they want them on or not.
@flamesoulis: Agree with this. I know they are important and can be helpful, but they also inhibit immersion for many. Easy to find and flip the switch, but off by default.
We plan to add nametags as a default feature that does not break immersion.
It would be nice if nametags were implemented in a way that rendered them at a fixed distance, so you don't have to make them YUGE just to see them in VR.

title: Terrain system
details: A request to sculpt a terrain within the engine so creators don't have to bring one in themselves from a 3rd party tool.

comments.value: If I can't also do things like caves or overhangs, I'm not as interested in this.
Please don't use height maps as the implementation of this. I should be able to have rock on the same level as grass, or such. Colored ID maps would be preferable.
I really want this. Preferably by loading a grey scale height map.
this could help with regular users be creative with their domains instead of having a flat primitive as a ground. really brings things back a step seeing domains that look so basic.
I think the engine used in project spark was very good:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sx4vaDvNuBg

We think this makes sense to do, but agree that the right approach is a powerful system like Spark, Voxels, etc which offers the ability to dig caves and overhangs, as well as an LOD system to make terrain visible at huge distances.  We will need a substantial team/project to take this on one, so it is likely a year or more out.   Additional comments welcome.

mergeHistory.postDetails: Can be implemented as either part of a whole in-world terrain system using height maps, or something that just imports Unity terrains, which use the same technique.

title: Disable vSync by default
details: While in HMD, the preview default on laptop screens appears to be disabled. The only way to fix that is to disable vSync. Default should be to show onlookers the view of the user who's in an HMD.
